title: [NA] Investigating Packet Loss Reports
body:
>##UPDATE 6/9
Thanks everyone for submitting your information!  We've gone through all of the reports, though so far we haven't found any consistent pattern to the packet loss.

>Since reports have started to slow down a bit, we're going to unsticky this thread, though we'll still have our eyes out for any future reports.  If you're still concerned about your own packet loss, we'd highly recommend that you [send us a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so that we can help to troubleshoot your connection.

>Thanks again!

------

>EDIT: Added in another step about trying the troubleshooting steps first :3 Please try the steps first so that we can rule out local networking issues!  Helps a *lot* to speed up our investigations


Hey everyone,

We've been reviewing threads on packet loss for the past week or so and while we haven't been able to find anything confirming widespread issues as of yet, we wanted to create a mega-thread to make it easier for us to collect information. 

With that said, here's how you can help.

1. Confirm that you're experiencing packet loss by uploading your [network logs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4) into our [Log Reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader)

2. If you are experiencing packet loss (should look something like [this](http://i.imgur.com/L0d3uWf.jpg) if you are), first attempt the resolution steps outlined in the KB article

2.  If you tried the troubleshooting steps and are still getting frequent packet loss, let us know the following information:


* Where you're playing from (City, State/Province)
* Who's your ISP (Comcast, CenturyLink, Shaw, etc.)
* [Trace route to game servers](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)

replies.body: Can we get an update on what's going on? I really hate playing with this lag and I would like to know when we would be able to play again with out constant stutters. Sorry to be so needy but I (and I assume the others) have been putting up with this for a while and we would like to at least have an ETA on the fix or atleast let us know where you guys are in the process so we can know how much longer we have to wait.

So I was messing around with my internet as I felt like I would try to fix the problem myself after many test games I finally got back to no packet drops or sliding champions.

what i did:
I have a net-gear router and I just basically set it back to the factory setting I think Comcast may have done something and made it incompatible with  the settings I had on my router so I just decided to revert it back and it worked.

now I don't know if this is what actually fixed my game but it certainly looks like it.
IMPORTANT: if you're living with your parents (like me) make sure to  ASK THEM BEFORE RESETTING THE ROUTER as it can cause other problems and if you mess something up you can just tell them "well why did you trust me in the first place"

Good Luck and I hope this helps.
Unfortunately this solution won't likely work for most people. Many people have tried this, and the packet loss we are experiencing doesn't happen every game. Keep on playing, and it will come back.
Yeah I had thought that was a solution sadly I was mistaken as the lag has returned for me

> [{quoted}](name=Kazulu Cthulhu,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=1ZEa1aL7,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2016-06-08T04:31:29.608+0000)
>
> Can we get an update on what's going on? I really hate playing with this lag and I would like to know when we would be able to play again with out constant stutters. Sorry to be so needy but I (and I assume the others) have been putting up with this for a while and we would like to at least have an ETA on the fix or atleast let us know where you guys are in the process so we can know how much longer we have to wait.

The scope of the issue hasn't been announced yet, so even if a problem is identified to be on the service provider's end, it might not fix problems for a few. With that being said, Riot is still collecting logs and gathering more information, so if you find anyone is having a similar issue, please direct them here.

Thanks!

I don't think I trust your diagnostic tool.
http://i.imgur.com/NBw8uKH.png
400 ping is definitely not "no issues".

Could you attach the netlog you used that gave you this result? It's possible that since your ping was stable, though high, that it determined there were no issues. We should get that fixed up though, and the easiest way is to check out the netlog you uploaded :)
http://pastebin.com/Ea1kK3S8

All right, this should be working now. I took a look at this netlog, and it actually had so many disconnections, there was only one line that had any network info. The netlog reader should account for this now and give you expected output.

I'll also add a disconnection counter since that info is quite useful too -- thanks man!
https://youtu.be/S65ZzffW-Cw
Thanks! I'll take a look here and see what's up with the tool. Once a fix is ready I'll let you know.

> [{quoted}](name=MarshmallowBob,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=1ZEa1aL7,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2016-06-08T00:17:44.997+0000)
>
> Could you attach the netlog you used that gave you this result? It's possible that since your ping was stable, though high, that it determined there were no issues. We should get that fixed up though, and the easiest way is to check out the netlog you uploaded :)

Not sure if this helps, but as soon as this started happening in NA, it had started to happen to me in Korea. It's happened in some of my games, where I just can't move and everything around my continues as normal. Disconnecting and then reconnecting always fixes the issue, though that's a pretty annoying solution. There's really no indication of when it will happen, because everything is totally normal until the random spike. I just thought I'd mention it, since I'm not on a US ISP.

It's possible that your Korean ISP peers with an ISP here that's having issues. Just to be sure it's connection-related though, you should try throwing a few netlogs into the reader here: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743

See what that looks like -- if it looks good, there might be another factor at play.

I have a similar story to others here - most of the time the game is smooth, and then I will get slammed with packet loss (the latest log per your log reader averaged 14-15% packet loss).  It tends to happen around 12PM CST for me.

Here is my tracert which is not connected to the packet loss timing.  If I experience it again, I'll run some more diagnostics, but the ping was consistently dropping packets in the 15% range when I was last trying to troubleshoot with Comcast, however I was experiencing zero issues with other applications (netflix, steam, other games were fine) - but I covered the basics of rebooting the modems / routers / calling Comcast - it's something on your end.

Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.1.1
  2    10 ms    11 ms    11 ms  x.x.x.x
  3    11 ms    10 ms     9 ms  xe-3-1-2-sur02.bearcreek.tx.houston.comcast.net [68.85.251.101]
  4    11 ms     9 ms    13 ms  ae-1-sur03.bearcreek.tx.houston.comcast.net [68.85.247.237]
  5    10 ms    14 ms    11 ms  ae-27-ar01.bearcreek.tx.houston.comcast.net [68.85.246.45]
  6    16 ms    19 ms    17 ms  be-33662-cr02.dallas.tx.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.92.61]
  7    16 ms    17 ms    16 ms  hu-0-11-0-1-pe03.1950stemmons.tx.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.86.130]
  8    17 ms    18 ms    16 ms  comcast-gw.la1.unitedlayer.com [75.149.228.202]
  9    36 ms    36 ms    42 ms  104.160.134.35
 10    36 ms    34 ms    35 ms  ae35-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.24]
 11    43 ms    42 ms    57 ms  104.160.131.36
 12    35 ms    36 ms    35 ms  104.160.131.44
 13    34 ms    36 ms    35 ms  104.160.131.101
 14    36 ms    35 ms    35 ms  192.64.170.1

Trace complete.

Here is your Log Analyzer over a period of 6 days that I played, and I play at similar times and lengths.  Over a 6 day period I had major lag on Saturday and Sunday night, was fine until Thursday, and then got slammed again Thursday night/Friday morning.  I have no instances of packet loss during early evening, it almost always happen around midnight.

http://imgur.com/cORo3q4 (June 3 - 12:27 AM)
http://imgur.com/GSeGWkI (June 2 - 10:58 PM)
No issues May 30 to June 1
http://imgur.com/IE7zlNh (May 29 - 12:45 AM)
http://imgur.com/41yxsNm (May 28 - 12:09 AM)

The fact that this consistently happens around the same time every night makes me think it might be a different issue.  Whenever I've seen similar reports in the past, it's been a sign of router or home network setting issues.  I'd be really interested in seeing your network traffic around that time compared to earlier in the day.

Unfortunately, boards isn't great for that, so what I'd recommend for you to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with the following information:

* [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1)
* [Network Information Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4)
* [Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)
* A Traceroute to the same IP (192.64.170.1) using a tool like WinMTR, which should give a bit more detailed information about what's happening with your packets on their way to the server

One of our techs should be able to look into it a bit more to verify whether or not it would be a local network thing. My instinct says it is, but could be wrong.  I'll try to follow it along, but let me know how it goes.

If you're not referring to me then sorry for commenting so much, but to be honest I'm not all that concerned with the packet loss. It generally only affects me for the first game I play, and reconnecting usually gets rid of it. If you have any updates whatsoever on the ping spikes, on the other hand, it would be much appreciated. Anything at all. Just started very recently, and again, it's been affecting everyone I've spoken to.

EDIT:

I'm dumb and looked up the wrong info, so deleting my comment and starting over!  My response was directed to Kyzarkit specifically, as his/her situation seems a bit different to most of the others commenting.  Haven't heard much about consistent ping spikes for most of NA, but we'll look out for those as well.

Consistent ping spikes is what I've been getting, usually in the range of 300-400ms from my usual 42, usually lasting ~3 minutes (but in my last game, went most of the game :S). Started happening this patch. Comcast in northampton MA.

Im having the same problems but mine sometimes goes all the way up to 12900ms and no that wasn't a typo how ever now it is just people sliding and moonwalking all over the place without an increase in ping.I'm also with comcast as seen in my earlier post.  imagine a fizz playful-ing his way up to you, It's not a fun time

> [{quoted}](name=Kazulu Cthulhu,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=1ZEa1aL7,comment-id=000600000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-06-08T04:24:15.662+0000)

Whenever I've had lag spikes that large it's because I'm on wifi and my laptop's wifi card sucks. #TeamEthernet

Ok so... the ticket I submitted ended up being the same (hence why I stopped answering to it), how is it that if the reports are limited to certain hours during the day/night you say it's the router's fault? the router has been working the exact same way since it was set up so how come it suddenly got reconfigured with one of YOUR patches?

more importantly even, how come we're able to load websites and even stream stuff like youtube WHILE packet loss is happening in-game? I did this kind of tests and seriously my internet was completely fine, if anything every time I get in game, the connection starts flickering but it NEVER does that with other games or while downloading any other stuff.

Are you saying that our ISP simply hate you? or maybe windows 10?

Do you understand where our rage come from? it all points to you, from our point of view of course, I even talked to my ISP and they said everything was ok and it is, everything BUT league of legends.

I really don't even care anymore, I play my games with the freaking packet loss and I try to do my best and if it's unbearable well sorry, it's a ruined game for my team, it's never so bad as to get completely disconnected and since I'm not the only one experiencing it everyone understands so there's no salt. Just a heads up, you should add this as a difficulty handicap at the patch notes: "we have made your ping completely unstable! good luck on the fields of justice!"

Upvote

Only since the last two patches have i been receiving issues with only League of legends where it would cause the game to crash and wont let me reconnect.  The only way I am able to reconnect is by closing out riot complete and letting everything stabilize again.

Tried firefox 46 and chromium 51 on win7.
What error is it giving you?

> [{quoted}](name=RiotBok,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=1ZEa1aL7,comment-id=0006000000020000,timestamp=2016-06-08T20:48:05.128+0000)
>
> What error is it giving you?

No error, I'm just redirected to the home page with another `signin?return_to=` added to the end of the url.

edit: Figured it out. riotgames.zendesk.com is setting a tracking cookie, and I have a browser extension installed that blocks those (privacy badger).

It would be great if I could send in a support ticket without consenting to third party tracking

:(

yea mine is completely random when it happens.

Playing from Gainesville, Florida, USA.

ISP is Cox.

Also, I told you this before, but if you had just sent engineers to look to see if **they could find anything**, they probably would have found it and fixed it by now. Instead you just say "there isn't a problem we have found so we won't send them."

For how long this is taking, this should have been resolved a long time ago.
You omitted your local address and left your public address in. Goof.
There's no public IPs in there.  The first hop (Usually something like 192.168.x.1) is just the local ping to your router. Shouldn't be any safety concerns from this alone.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotBok,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=1ZEa1aL7,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-07T22:26:28.382+0000)

Literally any information regarding the ping issues would be nice. Even if it's just "We have no idea what's going on". I know that one of my friends who lives close to the servers isn't having issues, but even he was in a game where people were complaining about the (very visible in the ping department) lag. 

Also I've noticed that GTA V's servers are limited on all fronts, not sure if that's related at all but it's definitely an odd coincidence.

Edit: sorry, you must have replied while I was typing.

Anyone else here deal with "Azreal" in Player Support/My Ticket section only for her/him to continuously blame your ISP despite facts proving to the contrary?

Thank you Bok for creating this thread. It's definitely an issue that's going on with League right now.

Playing from Roseville, CA, with Comcast as my ISP. 

Packet loss hasn't been as bad for the past few days, but it has occurred several times over the past few weeks and spikes to 10-15% packet loss. Thank you for putting this thread together Bok, we really appreciate it.


Tracert:

Here is a netlog that happened on June 3rd, the biggest packet loss I ever received:

http://imgur.com/WZZ9T1F

The lag goes on and off, and I can get a few ranked games in every once and awhile. Today was going fine, then bam just my recent game, a RANKED one, it happens, and in such I lose it. This is the netlog from the game:

http://imgur.com/yLQ69V2


Also I have sent a support ticket about this packet loss a couple days ago, and I sent them all the things you say to do, such as winMTR, network anaylsis, etc. Still haven't heard back since I replied to them saying that what they told me to do hasn't fixed the problem (clean boot, changing settings, etc).

I checked out your ticket and I'm sure you'll get more information there, but if you take a look at the network logs you submitted (the WinMTR ones) it looks like there's some pretty severe packet loss before your connection starts hitting League's servers.

I know it was mentioned before, but I want to reinforce that the best thing to do at this point would be to test different network configurations.  Easiest solution is usually taking your laptop and connecting directly via ethernet cable instead of WiFi, which is why it's said so often.  If that's not possible, some other things you can try are:

* Connect using another computer on the same network, preferably one that is using a wired connection
* Using your own laptop, connect using a different WiFi network, preferably a private network (basically something that's not a Starbucks public WiFi)

Well the thing is RiotBok, I'm in a college apartment and was only given the Wi-Fi settings. (I'm "sub leasing" unofficially to save money). I tried ethernet but wasn't given the settings to set it up so that won't work.

And the WiFi is a private one, but all my roommates share it. The thing is though, the League played fine for the first 4 weeks that I've been here, then bam last two weeks I get all this packet loss. I still don't see how it's on my end if it was working fine before.

http://i.imgur.com/lKKLcV0.png

Playing from Harvey, Louisiana.

EDIT: is your server designed to reject pings? Because about half of them fail. But I don't get packet loss in game.


Ping statistics for 192.64.170.1:
    Packets: Sent = 1286, Received = 658, Lost = 628 (48% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 46ms, Maximum = 181ms, Average = 63ms

Log reader generally isn't going to be super helpful in terms of consistently higher ping (i.e. your ping is usually 40, but moves to a constant 50).  If I'm understanding your concern correctly, I'd say it's more indicative of routing changes or changes along your route.

I wouldn't be super concerned  at a 10ms change, but if you notice further increases, I'd recommend [sending us a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for one of our tech specialists to review your connection.

Lost my promos last night because our mid started getting slammed with "attempting to reconnect" and what sounded like the kind of packet loss I was getting 3 days ago.

In general the update is just that we haven't found any consistent server-wide issues.  With that said, there have been various ISP issues over the past few days (I believe Comcast had some issues 2 days ago), but that would be on a regional and/or individual basis.

There's also a chance that there was just an interruption with that player's network.  If it's a friend of yours, I'd recommend letting them know to send us a ticket so that we can help figure out what's causing their connection issues.

Was having an issue today where my internet was fine until I started a game on the rift, which my internet went out three times during. When I wasn't on the rift my internet was fine. My ping would spike to 500+ms then my internet would go out. Then reconnect for a few minutes then go out again. This only happened during that rift match. My internet is stable for all other aspects of my web romps. Not sure if this is related, or if League is overloading the network somehow.

EDIT: I normally don't have this issue. This was the first occurrence of this situation I have experienced.

EDIT II: I have submitted a ticket with the appropriate files attached~

EDIT III: Regardless of the connection issues, I was still able to preform well, however I was "Attempting to Reconnect" during the time the enemy team surrendered so the game had ended before the connection became stable again.
